title: Lifelong Learning Project-Based Education for Enhancing Disaster Resilience

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Enhancing field applicability through practitioners' work integration and optimizing smartphone-centric learning environments

learning_goals: Learners explain three or more technology-based lifelong learning strategies for enhancing disaster resilience

For disaster risk reduction in construction environments, plan three or more practical PBL (Problem-Based Learning) projects (e.g., improving on-site safety inspection processes, developing disaster response manuals), submit project deliverables (reports, action plans, evaluation results) within six months, and produce outcomes meeting internal evaluation standards (80% validity, 85% feasibility)

Learners analyze three disaster response cases using smartphone-based collaboration tools (Slack, Notion, etc.), and collaboratively draft and share executable response manuals with team members within two weeks

Within six months, learners establish a lifelong learning network comprising over ten industry and academic experts via university-corporate collaboration platforms (e.g., LinkedIn groups, MOU-based workshops), and operate quarterly knowledge-sharing sessions (seminars/case study presentations) achieving over 80% participation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
